memberdef.name: QgsMeshLayer

briefdescription.para: Constructor - creates a mesh layer.

detaileddescription.para: The QgsMeshLayer is constructed by instantiating a data provider. The provider interprets the supplied path (url) of the data source to connect to and access the data.

parameterdescription.para: The path or url of the parameter. Typically this encodes parameters used by the data provider as url query items.
The name used to represent the layer in the legend
The name of the data provider, e.g., "mesh_memory", "mdal"

briefdescription.para: QgsMeshLayer cannot be copied.
Returns a new instance equivalent to this one except for the id which is still unique.
Returns new instance of QgsMapLayerRenderer that will be used for rendering of given context.
Returns the layer's data provider, it may be null.
Returns the layer's data provider in a const-correct manner, it may be null.
Interpolates the value on the given point from given dataset.

simplesect.para: It uses previously cached and indexed triangular mesh and so if the layer has not been rendered previously (e.g. when used in a script) it returns NaN value

parameterdescription.para: dataset index specifying group and dataset to extract value from
point to query in map coordinates

simplesect.para: interpolated value at the point. Returns NaN values for values outside the mesh layer, nodata values and in case triangular mesh was not previously used for rendering

memberdef.argsstring: (const QString &source, const QString &provider, const QgsReadWriteContext &context) const override
memberdef.name: decodedSource

briefdescription.para: Called by readLayerXML(), used by derived classes to decode provider's specific data source from project files.

detaileddescription.para: Typically resolving absolute or relative paths, usernames and passwords or drivers prefixes ("HDF5:")

parameterdescription.para: data source to decode, typically read from layer's DOM element "datasource"
string identification of data provider (e.g. "ogr"), typically read from layer's DOM element
reading context (e.g. for conversion between relative and absolute paths)

simplesect.para: decoded source, typically to be used as the layer's datasource

briefdescription.para: Called by writeLayerXML(), used by derived classes to encode provider's specific data source to project files.

detaileddescription.para: Typically resolving absolute or relative paths, usernames and passwords or drivers prefixes ("HDF5:")

parameterdescription.para: data source to encode, typically QgsMapLayer::source()
writing context (e.g. for conversion between relative and absolute paths)

simplesect.para: encoded source, typically to be written in the DOM element "datasource"

briefdescription.para: Returns the extent of the layer.
Returns native mesh (nullptr before rendering)

QgsMeshLayer cannot be copied.

briefdescription.para: Called by writeLayerXML(), used by children to write state specific to them to project files.

Returns true if the provider is in read-only mode.
Binds layer to a specific data provider.

parameterdescription.para: provider key string, must match a valid QgsMeshDataProvider key. E.g. "mesh_memory", etc.

briefdescription.para: Represents a mesh layer supporting display of data on structured or unstructured meshes.

detaileddescription.para: The QgsMeshLayer is instantiated by specifying the name of a data provider, such as mdal, and url defining the specific data set to connect to. The vector layer constructor in turn instantiates a QgsMeshDataProvider subclass corresponding to the provider type, and passes it the url. The data provider connects to the data source.
The QgsMeshLayer provides a common interface to the different data types. It does not yet support editing transactions.
The main data providers supported by QGIS are listed below.

sect2.title: Memory data providerType (mesh_memory)
sect2.para: The memory data provider is used to construct in memory data, for example scratch data. There is no inherent persistent storage of the data. The data source uri is constructed. Data can be populated by setMesh(const QString &vertices, const QString &faces), where vertices and faces is comma separated coordinates and connections for mesh. E.g. to create mesh with one quad and one triangle

sect2.title: MDAL data provider (mdal)
sect2.para: Accesses data using the MDAL drivers (https://github.com/lutraconsulting/MDAL). The url is the MDAL connection string. QGIS must be built with MDAL support to allow this provider.

simplesect.para: The API is considered EXPERIMENTAL and can be changed without a notice
